options.text: Sure, tell me.

A.text: The business is not doing so well, I'm afraid if we don't increase the sales, we should close.

options.text: That doesn't sound good. Give us some time, Jhonatan is working on a big story

B.text: A new story huh? We need something big like in your old good days.

options.text: I'm still in the good days my friend.

start.text: What are you going to do with the money?

options.text: I'll put it back in one of that restaurants.
We are running out of money, we can take some dollars to save the newspaper.

A.text: Let Betty do that for you, she will not draw suspicion.

options.text: You're right, it's better to focus on tomorrow's frontpage.
Hahaha, obviously. Betty can return the money to Mr Montana.

start.text: Mr Brown, its a shame that you regret our gift and also you publish that ugly things about our business.

options.text: We are not afraid of you

B.text: You should..., for your own good, moderate your language.

options.text: Bye
We don't have enough news ready to publish today, do you have something about Mr Montana?

D.text: Yes, I'll finish a note for you right now.

options.text: Thanks, the murder of Mr Roosvelt and this Montana thing...

E.text: That's true, we haven't these "happy days" back.

options.text: No, unfortunately...

start.text: let me introduce myself, some people know me as "Charlie the pretty"

options.text: I can see why.
I recognize your voice

A.text: Thanks darling, I hope the old Jhonatan is soon feeling well enough to come back to the office.

options.text: Why your boss paid for the hospital expenses?

B.text: Yes, we talked by telephone four days ago. I warning you dear.

options.text: That was a threat, not a warning...
Trying to kill a reporter is not a warning.

C.text: Call it as you want, but I told you about there would be consequences.

options.text: You almost killed one of the best well known reporters in the city.

D.text:
These stupid bullies, the idea was scare him a little, not trying to kill him...
It was a mistake. That's why the dear Andy take care of all the costs of the hospital.
Darling, we don't want more fake news about our business ok?

options.text: We're doing our jobs.

E.text: Do it well then, bye darling.

start.text: I read the news you published about Montana, you declared war at him.

options.text: Jhonatan is the man behind the story, his investigation is worth to be told.

A.text: And we at the "Bureau of Investigation" know about it, we want you to collaborate with us in this case.

options.text: What kind of collaboration are you looking for?
Sorry Mr Evans but after the assesination of Mr Roosvelt I don't want to be involved with any goverment institution.

B.text: We've been following this case for some months, but we need more proves to put Andy behind bars. We only need to work together.

options.text: Count with us
I think you can put us in more danger if they discovered this "collaboration" as you called.

C.text: Thanks Mr Brown, I'll contact you soon.

options.text: Good bye

D.text: I appreciate your concern, take a time to think about it, and I'll contact you later when Mr Ross will return to work.

options.text: Thanks...

E.text:
We already found the guilty and put him behind bars.
The new goverment only wants to guarantee the order for all the Americans.

options.text: I appreciate your efforts, but leave us work by ourselves. Have a good day Mr Evans.

start.text:
Hi Darling, we know that a BOI agent contacted you looking for an alliance against us.
You know that you can't attack us again, right?

options.text: Your methods can intimidate someone weak, but we will not fall in to your threats.
We haven't talk again and I don't want to be involved between them and you.

A.text: Maybe if I come a little closer?

options.text: Get away from me.

B.text: You are already involved in it. We write a small note that you can publish to help us to distract this guy for a while.

options.text: Give it to me, I'll take a look.
I'll not publish lies in the Democracy Times, go away!

C.text: You don't have to be rude!, I'm seriously worried about you.

options.text: Have a good day Charlie.

D.text: Clever boy, that is the attitude I found sexy in a man.

options.text: I hope we don't need to see you again.

start.text: Leave me follow this clue, I can check if this is a trap or a really witness.

options.text: I think is better to inform about this to Mr Evans.
What if is a trap?, I'm worried about your safety.

A.text: I would prefer not to do it. I don't trust in them, but is your choice.

options.text: I know it, but I'd hate to end up with you hurt or dead. I'll call him.
I don't trust them either... Go ahead Jhonatan.

B.text: I'm an old man Ben, if you have nothing to lose, you can only win.

options.text: The people can lose a great reporter, I'm not going to let you risk your life.
You brave, brave man. Your reputation precedes you. Go ahead Jhonatan

C.text: I have a bad feeling about this...

options.text: We haven't more options, I'll contact him after finishing the tomorrow's frontpage.

D.text: So, I'll prepare a meeting with Phil. Wish me luck.

options.text: Hope you do well.

start.text: I'm sorry for your lost, Jhonatan will be remember for his dedicated efforts and commitment to pursue the truth.

options.text: Leave us! someone told Andy about that meeting and I think it was one of your guys.
It was my fault, I leaved him to go after it without consulting you.

A.text: All the people that works in this case were selected by me, all of them are respectable people. The pigeon is not on our team Mr Brown.

options.text: I can't trust anybody, no more. Leave me alone.
I don't know what to believe... there is a witness against Tony.

B.text: Don't charge you about it, you didn't kill him. It was Tony

options.text: You are right, we need to stop him now! There is a witness against Tony.

C.text: We are not the enemy Mr Brown, they are.

options.text: Get out of here!

D.text: We need to talk with him as fast as possible before Tony

options.text: I'll give you the information that I have.

start.text: Hi darling, thanks for helping us with that little problem.

options.text: I've done with you, please leave us alone.

A.text: Sure, but you know it looks like Jhonatan hasn't learned the lesson. I know that him continues asking people about our business.

options.text: I talked with him about put an end to this story, but he don't want to.
I'll talk with Jhonatan one more time, please don't hurt him.

B.text: If you help us with some personal information about him, you don't need to talk with us never again.

options.text: What are you suggesting? this conversation is over!
I'm not sure... but he is not going to stop.
bye

D.text: Don't tell me more. I'll visit you tomorrow morning.

start.text: Without Jhonatan the sales will go down. what are you going to do Ben?

options.text: There is a war between Andy Montana and Phil Romano for the control of the Alcohol business

A.text: And do you think is a good idea to publish that article after all the problems you had?

options.text: I've been living with fear the last months, maybe is time to face these criminals.

B.text: It's your choice Ben, I trust you.

options.text: thanks, it's time to work.
